intro: Hibbertia spathulata subsp. pleioclada, commonly known as the broad-leafed hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers with prominent red stamens. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain multiple seeds. Hibbertia spathulata subsp. pleioclada is a shrub that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height, displaying a compact and bushy growth habit.
